text.textblock: In accordance with the Federal Advisory Committee Act (Pub. L. 92-463, as amended), the National Science Foundation (NSF) announces the following three meetings of the Special Emphasis Panel in Mathematical Sciences.
Room 1020, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, Virginia.
Dr. H. Jean Thiebaux, Program Director, Division of Mathematical Sciences, Room 1025, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA 22230. Telephone: (703) 306-1883.
To review and evaluate Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Industrial Research Fellowship proposals as part of the selection process for awards.
Room 330, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, Virginia.
Dr. Joseph Jenkins, Program Director, Division of Mathematical Sciences, Room 1025, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA 22230. Telephone: (703) 306-1870 ext. 1978.
To review and evaluate proposals concerning Lie Groups and their representations as part of the selection process for awards.
Room 1020, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, Virginia.
Dr. John V. Ryff, Program Director, Division of Mathematical Sciences, Room 1025, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA 22230. Telephone: (703) 306-1879.
To review and evaluate Research Planning Grants and Career Advancement Awards for Women Scientists and Engineers proposals as part of the selection process for awards.
To provide advice and recommendations concerning support for research proposals submitted to the NSF for financial support.

The proposals being reviewed include information of a proprietary or confidential nature, including technical information; financial data, such as salaries; and personal information concerning individuals associated with the proposals. These matters are exempt under 5 U.S.C. 552b(c) (4) and (6) of the Government in the Sunshine Act.

doctitle.textblock: Special Emphasis Panel in Mathematical Sciences; Notice of Meetings
